ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] eq at work
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah. some newbs can be pretty dense when asking for stuff. I have ppl asking my bard for sow. and she s lvl 12. I went anon as my cleric and some newb started
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah. some newbs can be pretty dense when asking for stuff. I have ppl
asking my bard for sow. and she's lvl 12. I went anon as my cleric and some
newb started following me around asking me for clarity. I told him I'm not
an enc. He asked for sow. i explained I couldn't sow. (I'm a high elf for
pities sake). Then he asked for str buff. I started to say that I didn't use
reckless str bc it's negative effects were too annoying. Then my group
partner said to the newb "We are on a quest. The mana is reserved for the
completion of that quest." and the guy shut up. Heh. my groupie got really
protective. when teh newb pulled mobs over to me when I was medding, my
groupie started saying "Don't train my cleric! You pull trains on my cleric,
I let you die!"
Sadly the guy didn't get the hint and he added us both to his friend's
list...
And I don't know how but he was looing things we killed right after we
killed them... some kinda bug.
ack. didn't mean to sound complaining. I was actually having fun. once the
newb went away my groupie and I kicked ass and got lots of cool stuff.
btw, the ghoulbane quest is now broken.
luv,
-Su

> I play a level 41 druid on Tarew Marr, and for the very reasons you
stated,
> I go <anon> or <roleplay> when I am grouped and fighting, or otherwise
busy.
> At least then people cannot pick me out from some far-off place with /who
> all druid 39 44, for example. My appearance is a dead giveaway, though. I
> LOOK like a druid.
>
> Don't get me wrong -- I enjoy helping people out. Some days I do nothing
but
> help out newbies or teleport and SOW people on corpse runs, but when I am
> seriously playing, the constant tells and requests get downright
intrusive.
>
> Froondor, Wood Elf Druid of 41 seasons, Tarew Marr
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Hanna Clutterbuck" <karra42@...>
> To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, January 22, 2002 5:37 PM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] eq at work
>
>
> > I don't think I have the patience to ever play a
> > caster -- the 30th person to ask me for SoW, would
> > probably get nuked.
> >
> > -Hanna
